Key Match Events: The Lakers trailed 61-52 at halftime, then outscored Phoenix 35-24 in the third quarter to take the lead.
The Lakers led by 12 points in the fourth quarter.
The Lakers trailed 81-74 with three minutes left in the third quarter before scoring nine straight points to grab the lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis scored 35 points, Austin Reaves added 26 and the Los Angeles Lakers rallied to beat the Phoenix Suns 123-116 on Friday night for their first 2-0 start since 2010-11.
LeBron James had 17 of his 21 points in the second half for the Lakers, who trailed by 22 points in the second quarter.
